page.title: 10History Newcastle-u-LMarket
page.content: The first market place was in Upper Green now the A34 Road.This moved to the High Street about 1280.The whole of the present High Street would have been a Large Market place.In 1203 the original Sunday Market was moved to Saturday,then to Monday in 1590.In the early 19th c.Saturday became a 2nd market day and later Friday a 3rd.In 1853 the first covered market was built to supplement the portable street market and to offer a halfway house between shop and stall.This was replaced in 1963 by a more up-to-date covered market.There is also a weekly cattle market (Monday), which since 1871 has been housed in the Smithfield Cattle Market.The Market today is still a thriving concern with traders selling many types of goods at modest prices.
